Odd a is a proposition ∃ k, a = 2 * k + 1
Even n is a proposition: ∃ r, n = r + r

Question: Why is Even n not ∃ r, n = 2 * r ?

There is consistency when using the lemma:

lemma even_or_odd' (n : ℕ) : ∃ k, n = 2 * k ∨ n = 2 * k + 1

but not when using the lemma:

lemma even_or_odd (n : ℕ) : Even n ∨ Odd n

If you define Even with addition, there is no reference to multiplication, so you do not need to assume it. I think this is why the definition is as is. Odd is more odd than Even, so that justifies the difference.
(Not using multiplication for defining Even also means that you can "unify" results about Even and results about squares.)

This is because we also want to talk about square elements, and multiplication cannot be "multiplicativised". Scalar multiplication can, however. One can multiplicativise 2 • a to a ^ 2. We decided to write a + a and a * a instead of 2 • a and a ^ 2, but I don't think there is any particular reason
One possible reason could be less notation. Also, I think that it is less surprising to see a sum than a smul if you unfold Even.
Btw, this was the consequence of a long Zulip discussion, let me see if I can find it.
Here in Lean 3 and starting with obsolete bit0 and bit1!

Thanks - I tried to read that thread on lean 3's odd and even.. most of it is too advanced for me.

So I'll ask one final question on this.

I think I understand why Even is defined as r+r so only addition is used. I don't know the reason specifically, but I can see less assumptions are better.

If that is the case, why is Odd not defined as r+r+1 which again only uses addition, no multiplication?

I don't neeed to know the answer, just asking out of interest.

I think that mostly the reason is how useful the concepts are. My personal ranking is

  • definitely squares should have an API,
  • Even is good, can be useful for general rings, especially when 2 is not invertible,
  • Odd... who needs odd anyway?

For odd, there is also no clear preference between it being defined as you suggest or as simply "not even". Since no one has a use either way, there was no reason to change.

Odd is fun:

import Mathlib

example (x : NNReal) : Odd x ↔ 1 ≤ x := by
  constructor
  · rintro ⟨k, rfl⟩
    simp
  · intro hx
    use (x - 1) / 2
    field_simp [tsub_add_cancel_of_le hx]
